intro: Stenogyne purpurea, commonly known as the purple stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically purple or pink in color. The plant has a shrub-like growth habit with woody stems and narrow, elliptical leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
